item.title: osama bin laden: 9/11 author who defied bush, obama
item.description: challenging the might of the "infidel" united states, osama bin laden masterminded the deadliest militant attacks in history and then built a global network of allies to wage a "holy war" intended to outlive him.

item.title: high wind and drought fuel wildfires in west texas
item.description: mother nature's capricious and destructive rule was on full display in the great plains over the weekend, as wildfires roared across west texas, tornadoes ripped across iowa and the red river flooded in south dakota.

item.title: jude law takes lead in tabloid spying case
item.description: actor jude law is taking a lead role in a court battle over the wide-ranging spying campaign mounted by a british tabloid newspaper.

item.title: u.s. republicans push to repeal healthcare funds
item.description: in a renewed attack against president barack obama's healthcare overhaul program, house republicans voted on tuesday to deny funding for a central element of the law that sets up marketplaces for people to shop for health insurance coverage.

item.title: life in prison for kidnapper of smart
item.description: nearly nine years after she was abducted at knifepoint, elizabeth smart watched a federal judge order a street preacher to spend the rest of his life in prison.

item.title: magnet therapy didn't help "ringing in the ears"
item.description: a constant annoying ringing in the ears - called tinnitus - didn't go away when researchers tried zapping patients' heads with magnetic waves in a recent study.

item.title: dilbert lets users become part of the comic strip
item.description: dilbert readers can now swap places with the eternally befuddled office drone and his not-so-sharp cubicle dwellers.

item.description: kindle seen as clear leader, with nook a pleasant surprise.

item.title: tepco's liability may be capped at $24-45 billion: report
item.description: japan may cap tokyo electric power's liability to as little as $24 billion for damages stemming from its crippled nuclear plant, the yomiuri newspaper reported, citing a draft plan being considered by the plant operator and the government.

item.title: prince william back at work after royal wedding
item.description: it was back to the day job for britain's prince william on tuesday, four days after he married long-term girlfriend kate middleton in a royal wedding watched by hundreds of millions of people around the world. the 28-year-old returned to his royal air force (raf) base in anglesey, wales, in time to resume his job as a search and rescue pilot, after a short break at a secret location.

item.title: serbia says jailed mladic will face war crimes trial
item.description: after 15 years, ratko mladic, the former bosnian serb general accused of ordering the massacre of muslims in 1995, was captured. he will be sent to the hague for trial.

item.title: it isn't over until she says
item.description: after not qualifying for the 2010 olympics, the figure skater alissa czisny has a chance to add a triumphant chapter to her career.

item.title: red carpet report: 'x-men first class'
item.description: the x-men saga hits rewind and turns back to the franchise's cold war beginning.

item.title: asia: dissident plans a more active role in myanmar
item.description: daw aung san suu kyi appeared on a video link from yangon to tell an audience in hong kong that she would seek to broaden her audience in her country since being released from house arrest.

item.title: overstock.com puts its name on oakland coliseum
item.description: the online retailer will pay the oakland-alameda county stadium authority $7.2 million over six years for the naming rights.

item.title: al qaeda members hide in brazil, raise money: report
item.description: al qaeda operatives are in brazil planning attacks, raising money and recruiting followers, a leading news magazine reported saturday, renewing concerns about the nation serving as a hide-out for islamic militants.

item.title: west: temple 66, penn state 64: fernandez's basket gives temple 66-64 win over psu
item.description: juan fernandez sank an off-balance 18-footer with under a second to play thursday to give temple a wild victory over penn state.

item.description: almost three months have gone by now, but sometimes to a father it seems like years.

item.title: maine mother cause of death could take weeks to determine
item.description: the cause of death of a maine woman whose body was discovered in a new hampshire pond four days after she disappeared may take several weeks to determine, authorities said on thursday.

item.title: fda revives oxigene's thyroid cancer drug hopes, shares surge
item.description: oxigene inc said u.s. health regulators indicated that its experimental thyroid cancer drug may warrant further development, cheering investors a month after the company stopped enrollment in a drug trial.

item.description: while the injury did not appear to be too severe, the mets' recent experience with jason bay has made them cautious in dealing with such an injury.

item.description: multiple relocations are surprisingly common and often harmful to the elderly. poor communication regarding medical needs is often to blame, experts say.

item.title: cbo says $871 billion deficit so far in fy 2011
item.description: the budget deficit totaled $871 billion for the first seven months of this fiscal year, significantly above the previous year's pace, the congressional budget office said on friday.

item.description: all appear to have been connected to the same beauty parlor.

item.title: 1872 mining law threatens grand canyon
item.description: a u.s. law from the pick-and-shovel days of the western frontier now threatens natural treasures including grand canyon national park as mining claims on public lands proliferate, an environmental group said on friday.

item.title: more pressure on pakistani military over bin laden

item.title: u.s. hopes to question bin laden's wives
item.description: the united states was hoping on tuesday to question the detained three wives of osama bin laden although pakistani officials played down the possibility of any speedy access, saying no decision had been made.

item.title: bombers take bin laden revenge in pakistan
item.description: suicide bombers killed 80 people at a pakistani paramilitary academy on friday in revenge for the death of osama bin laden in a u.s. raid and militants in pakistan vowed to carry out more attacks.

item.title: u.s. may release photos of bin laden burial at sea
item.description: the united states may release later on tuesday photos of osama bin laden's burial at sea, a u.s. official told reuters, in a move that might quieten speculation the al qaeda leader was not really killed in a u.s. raid on his pakistani compound.

item.title: u.s. intensifies drone aircraft attacks in pakistan
item.description: a u.s. drone aircraft fired missiles at militants in pakistan on thursday, killing eight of them, pakistani officials said, as american officials vowed to press forward with such attacks after u.s. forces killed osama bin laden in his pakistani hideout.

item.title: kerry in pakistan with tough questions, meets army
item.description: u.s. senator john kerry met pakistan's powerful army chief on sunday to press for answers on osama bin laden, but he will also be keen to ensure pakistani anger over the u.s. raid does not subvert security cooperation.

item.title: pakistan's parliament warns u.s. over bin laden raid
item.description: pakistan's parliament condemned on saturday the u.s. raid that killed osama bin laden, warning pakistan might cut supply lines to u.s. forces in afghanistan if there were further military incursions.

item.title: u.s. doubts pakistan's plan to defeat taliban: report
